name: Wherry Line Day Ranger (Norwich-Gt Yarmouth/Lowestoft)
description: WHERRY LINE RANGER Unlimited travel for one day with weekday time restrictions from Norwich through the Norfolk Broads to the coastal resorts of Lowestoft and Great Yarmouth in Norfolk.

fares_and_restrictions.raw: fares & restrictions New fares from 2nd Mar 2025 One day ranger adult: £13.50 child (5-15): £6.75 family*: £27.00 senior#: £9.00 railcards ⯆ 16 26 SE DI 2T FF H V : £9.00 DI FF H child fare: £2.00 Railcards ⯈ Railcards: 16 = 16-25 26 = 26-30 SE = Senior DI = Disabled 2T = Two Together FF = Family & Friends H = HM Forces V = Veterans *Family tickets are for up to two adults and up to two children #Senior tickets apply to anyone over the age of 60 and accompanied children travel for £2.00 Previous fares ⯈ Previous fares (adult): 2024 - £12.90 2023 - £12.00 2022 - £11.50 2021 - £11.50 2020 - £11.50 2019 - £11.00 2018 - £9.00 2014 - £9.00 2011 - £7.80 time restrictions Mon to Fri: valid from 08:45 No restrictions at weekends or bank holidays Also valid on the 08:36 Norwich-Gt Yarmouth train operating companies Greater Anglia purchasing Online: X Train conductor: ✔ * Station ticket office: ✔ Ticket Vending Machine: i Northern Ticket Vending Machines now sell most ranger and rover tickets but at the moment only for same-day travel (rather prohibitive for distant areas) Some Avanti West Coast station TVMs for example Crewe, now sell local rangers and rovers. LNER TVMs at Doncaster, Edinburgh, London King's Cross, Newcastle and York also sell them. A number of PTE areas sell local rangers from TVMs in their area e.g. South Yorkshire, Strathclyde and West Midlands * valid ticket to travel is required unless boarded at a station without ticket-issuing facilities

stations: Buckenham Cantley Great Yarmouth Haddiscoe Lingwood
Lowestoft Norwich Oulton Broad North Reedham Somerleyton
